issue.title: [CF 210] Smaller Timeintervals
issue.body:
Your addon only allows times to be set by seconds, however I'd often like to track stuff with an accuracy down to a tenth of a second. Examples: I don't want to cast another Cyclone into an already existing Cyclone; I don't want to cast Slam if Mortal Strike is coming off cooldown within the next global.


> Posted by CurseForge user AmeroGer | Imported from CurseForge issue #210 | Raw

comments.body:
Ok. You are just talking about conditions, correct? The duration min/max settings on the main tab of the icon editor do allow decimals. Adding this to conditions will be pretty easy (actually, as of writing this, I already put this in)


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Could you also add timers on the icons to display tenth's of a second remaining after a designated minimum duration has been reached?


> Posted by CurseForge user AmeroGer

This can be done in OmniCC's settings.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras
